results.name: The lowest order term in an expansion of sum_{i=1..m}*i^n*(i+1)! in a special factorial basis.
comment: For each n there unique numbers a(n) and b(n) and a polynomial p_n such that for all integers m: Sum_{i=1..m} i^n *(i+1)! = a(n) + b(n)*sum_{i=1..m}(i+1)! + p_n(m)*(m+2)! The sequence b(n) is A074051(n), and this sequence here are the a(n).
mathematica: A[a_] := Module[{p, k}, p[n_] = 0; For[k = a - 1, k >= 0, k--, p[n_] = Expand[p[n] + n^k Coefficient[n^a - (n + 2)p[n] + p[n - 1], n^(k + 1)]] ]; -2 p[0] ]
